title.narrative: Wash Emergency response for new IDPs in Idlib and Northern Aleppo with consideration the needs of disabled persons

description.narrative:
According to HNO 2020, The conflict in Syria has created and exacerbated large-scale humanitarian needs around water, sanitation, and hygiene (WASH) for the country’s population. Women are disproportionately affected by a lack of access to WASH services and facilities due to both biological and social factors. Women and girls have specific needs around menstrual and reproductive health, which if unmet can have wide-reaching adverse effects on health, maternal and infant health, The escalation of hostilities from 1 December 2019 to 31 January 2020 resulted in the displacement of nearly 520, 000 people mainly from southern Idleb and western Aleppo governorates, 80% of displaced are women and children. Many of the people displaced have been displaced several times, intensifying existing vulnerabilities. More people have moved in the interim period through this project, under (ASO)1-(ASO)2 Objectives IHR will implement six interviews:
1-Installation 20 latrine units, the latrine to set up includes 5 cabins. This allows to meet the condition of health standards. 4 cabins toilets one of them for PWD’ the fifth one will be path room. 3 Water tank 1m3 should be fixed above each latrine set.
2- Supply and distribution 22680 m3 of water via trucks to 4,200 BNF most affected population in three Camps in (Maaret Tamsrin, Afrin) districts attached locations .
3-Installation of water tanks and water points (4 tanks capacity of 45m3 will be received from Ihsan RD or other UNICEFs partners warehouses if possible,
4-Supply safe water through trucking or connection to existing systems, by contraction of water network with four main points in each camp to facilitate the water distribution, in addition to that this network will be ready in future when we get chance to arrive the general network to the camps
5-Hygiene promotion training for community mobilizers for hygiene promoters, increased hygiene awareness and adaptation at household levels and community participation, organized communities to practice hygiene behaviors and this training will target the population in Camps and community with high priority for PWD, women and GBV survivor.
6) Aligns with training activity, IHR depending on wash cluster recommendation will Distribute of WASH NFIs and hygiene kits and IEC to affected population (700 Family Hygiene kits, Related to all above intervention IHR will considered the PWD, Women headed household, GBV survivor and sex segregated public latrines based thorough consultation with the users separate queues for men and women while distributing hygiene kits and ensure the presence of female staff during distributions. mitigation measures to prevent Sexual exploitation and abuse including from construction workers/landlords, in camps, outside of camps, for the shelter rehabilitation or for free rental activities, etc. its worth to mentioned that related to locations selection IHR will coordinate with cluster and partners in Afrin and Mareet Tmesrin districts . To avoid any tension between IDPs and HC ,IHR will target 10% of host community
IHR is required to develop their project with a strong risk management strategy.
